docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.text: Page 4 After GitHub Actions We used GitHub Actions to deploy the MkDocs site automatically. .github/workflows/ci.yml name: ci on: push: branches: - master jobs: deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v2 - uses: actions/setup-python@v2 with: python-version: 3.8 - run: pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force
docs.title: Page 4 After GitHub Actions

docs.text: We used GitHub Actions to deploy the MkDocs site automatically. .github/workflows/ci.yml name: ci on: push: branches: - master jobs: deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v2 - uses: actions/setup-python@v2 with: python-version: 3.8 - run: pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force
docs.title: Page 4 After GitHub Actions

docs.text: Page 5 The final page is page 5. All we need to do to deploy is: git add . git commit -m "message" git push origin master
docs.title: Page 5

docs.text: The final page is page 5. All we need to do to deploy is: git add . git commit -m "message" git push origin master
